alert.note: Alert for Oneida; Vilas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact Vilas and northern Oneida Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 340 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Watersmeet to 7 miles south of Boulder Junction to 6 miles east of Lac Du Flambeau to 6 miles east of Phillips. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boulder Junction and Willow Lake around 355 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Johnson Lake Barrens Natural Area, Willow Reservoir, Squirrel Lake, Phelps and Rainbow Flowage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Wisconsin.
